definition: Common inherited bleeding disorder due to quantitative or qualitative defects of von Willebrand factor → impaired platelet adhesion and secondary reduction of factor VIII levels → mucocutaneous bleeding.
why_it_matters: Most prevalent inherited bleeding disorder; usually mild and responsive to desmopressin, but peri‑procedural planning is crucial.
how_youll_see_it: Easy bruising, epistaxis, **menorrhagia**, and bleeding after dental work.
Labs: normal platelet count, **prolonged bleeding time**, normal PT, and **PTT normal or mildly prolonged**.
problem_solving: Type 1 disease responds to **desmopressin** (endothelial release of vWF and factor VIII).
Severe disease/major surgery: **vWF‑containing concentrates** ± tranexamic acid.
Avoid aspirin/NSAIDs which worsen mucosal bleeding.

differentials.name: Hemophilia A
differentials.hint: Hemarthroses/deep bleeding; normal bleeding time; markedly ↑PTT; X‑linked.

differentials.name: Bernard–Soulier syndrome
differentials.hint: GPIb defect with macrothrombocytes and thrombocytopenia.

tricks: Platelet **adhesion** uses vWF–GPIb; platelet‑to‑platelet aggregation uses **GPIIb/IIIa**.
Pregnancy and stress can raise vWF levels—bleeding may improve transiently.
exam_appearance: Teen with heavy menses and epistaxis, normal platelets, prolonged bleeding time, mild ↑PTT → von Willebrand disease.
Dental extraction in mild vWD—best prophylaxis is **desmopressin**.
treatment: Type 2/3 or major surgery/trauma: **vWF/factor VIII concentrate**.
Menorrhagia: combined hormonal contraception or LNG‑IUD; add tranexamic acid during menses if needed.
red_flags: Massive bleeding unresponsive to DDAVP → give **vWF concentrate**.
algorithm: Mucocutaneous bleeding history → CBC (platelets), PT/PTT, and ristocetin assay.
If consistent with vWD → treat per severity (DDAVP vs vWF concentrate).
For procedures: test DDAVP response beforehand; add antifibrinolytic for oral/ENT surgery.

cases.stem: 17‑year‑old with recurrent nosebleeds and heavy menses.
cases.teaching: Defective vWF impairs platelet adhesion and reduces factor VIII; desmopressin increases endothelial release of vWF.

cases.stem: Known vWD patient scheduled for dental extraction.
cases.answer: Give desmopressin prior to the procedure; consider tranexamic acid post‑op.
